title: The Advent of Lord Krishna | Sri Stoka Krishna Maharaj | SB 10.3.13 | 15.08.2024
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: Krishna is nothing external and internal.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that true knowledge is not merely perceiving forms through senses or intellect, as these are external coverings, and contrasts this with Krishna, who is not separate from His form.

themes: Mother Yashoda's attempt to bind Krishna
segments.key_quote: Krishna Supreme Lord has no inside has no outside.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Mother Yashoda trying to bind Krishna, emphasizing that Krishna's form is immeasurable and transcendental, unlike material objects.

segments.key_quote: To understand Krishna to know Krishna to see Krishna to perceive Krishna is possible only by transcendental knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that neither the soul nor Krishna can be measured due to their lack of physical form, and understanding Krishna requires transcendental knowledge.

segments.key_quote: Krishna says four kinds of people begin to render devotional service to Him.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the four kinds of pious people who surrender to Krishna, emphasizing that the ज्ञानी (one situated in knowledge) is the best because they are constantly devoted to worshipping Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Real bhakti is we worship that transcendent form of God from the beginning and even in the end always we only worship God real God.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts deity worship with the Mayavadi philosophy, explaining that true bhakti involves worshipping the transcendental form of God from the beginning, which can only be perceived through transcendental knowledge.

segments.key_quote: The science of Krishna Consciousness helps us understand that God has appeared in a form which we can see or perceive sound form or material metal form.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that while God cannot be perceived simply through material senses, the science of Krishna Consciousness helps us understand that God appears in forms we can perceive, but these forms are transcendental, not material.

segments.key_quote: Krishna can be seen or understood or known or worshiped only by bhakti.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing that transcendental knowledge, necessary to perceive Krishna, is realized through devotional service, highlighting Vasudeva's pure devotion and the importance of Sadhana Bhakti in awakening this knowledge.
